maybe I'm wrong about that maybe it does I'd have to think more about it but it certainly does take
humility to be able to engage in these conversations which how ironic that for so long
what Christians what people have experienced about Christians feels like sometimes a lack of humility
a pride and so if the way we're talking about it if some of this is right then man maybe it takes
maybe maybe that's part of what's crippled us in some ways is that we've seemed like people who
weren't open to those conversations that we were people who weren't willing to to question even our
own beliefs and yet too dogmatic I think it is I think it is humbling I mean you have to be humble
to receive that gift because everything in us wants to say I earned it yeah that's true there
is a humbling of yourself going I'm so pathetic that I the only thing I contributed was the sin
that needed to be forgiven yep I did have a I did have a let you were referencing John 3 16 and
at a at a renaissance fair one time when I was asking questions I don't know if you knew I
used to do that but to go out to I was a renaissance fair near here that I would go out on Sunday
mornings really and just say okay what do you want to talk about I'm a Christian we'll talk
about whatever and they would I would bring donuts and coffee and really and boy I got some
I got some good questions yeah yes there was no filter about what questions got asked it oh it
was wonderful and there was a lady who played the harp and and so a lot of these people are grow up
in traditional Christian families they've rejected that or walked away from that a lot of them had
but but it was still like really interesting so but what strikes me is there was a lady some of
the guys asked this lady with a harp could you play could we sing um Amazing Grace together
which again a whole bunch of them going out how do we I want to sing Amazing Grace like
okay we obviously we sing that and she was like I don't sing that song I'm not a wretch oh wow and
and thinking oh yeah yeah to sing that song you have to admit you're a wretch
so there is something about that um that we there is a recognition that has to happen there
and uh and what that would take but so I don't you know I don't know that we've come to any
obvious clear answers here like well you do a b and c and then you'll know you're doing it correctly
but knowing there's there are a lot of you guys out there who you know who are listening to this
who maybe you've been asking that question of gosh it's I want to ask some of these questions but
I do believe there is a god I do believe that there is a holy and righteous god and I don't
I mean I don't want to be offensive I don't want to be um and I don't think we want to presume
upon him and yet I do think the Bible offers us enough examples whether it's through David or
through the questions or through the churches that that I think I think God can handle the
questions we have and and maybe it's right to say that he would he would want us to ask the questions
of him but but for our own sake the right way to do it would be humbly respectfully
I don't know any thoughts to add to that no no I think that's good that's that's that's
it's it's a wrestling match sometimes it's it's tough so anyway this has been this has been good
for me to even talk through and maybe maybe some part of it Chris is also maybe I need to look at
the rest of my life and see if the rest of my life indicates that I do treat him with respect
and I do treat him as holy and high and lift it up and and maybe if the rest of my life does that
then that makes it a whole lot easier right if my children are are otherwise respectful oh you know
what it reminds me of uh I know we're wrapping up and then I just thought of this um a student
years ago who I was discipling um a guy named Nathan and he um he decided the teacher wanted
him to read a book and I can't remember for sure what the book was it may have been Kecher and the
Rye but there was a book he had to read as an honor student and write a paper on and he started
reading it and discovered some material in it that he thought was inappropriate for him he was like
this is going to tempt me this is something I don't need to read this is going to put bad thoughts in
my head and so he went to the teacher and said can you give me a different assignment I don't
I don't want to read this book and here's why and the teacher said because Nathan was number one in
his class by the way and he said and the teacher said I'm paraphrasing but if if you'd been almost
any other student I would have just thought you're trying to get out of work right but because I know
you're a hard worker I know you're respectful I know these things about you then I know your
motive for this is is you just you just want to protect your heart and mind from some of this
material so yes I'll let you take a different assignment now the good news is God doesn't have
to guess at what our motives and our heart is and and he also knows it's imperfect and flawed
so I just I think we make the effort to try to have the right heart and the right motive when we
ask these questions well it's almost like your uh how Zachariah responds to Gabriel versus how
Mary responds to Gabriel yeah oh yeah yeah yeah how's that going to be but apparently Zachariah's
attitude was more doubting skeptical something and there was more uh the mechanics are like how
can this be but again God knows the heart sounds good well if you're wrestling with this too I hope
this has been helpful great it has been for me so I appreciate it and uh and we will talk to you
guys next time all right all right bye thank you for joining us for this episode of Reconstructed
Faith if you enjoyed what you heard or were challenged please leave us a review it'll help
other people find us if you have questions or a topic you'd like to hear discussed shoot me an
email at info at southspring.org. Reconstructed Faith is a resource of South Spring Baptist Church.
Remember don't give up trust God search for answers.
